page.title: 09ISLE OF WIGHT COUNTY PRESS
page.content: Founded in 1884 the County Press was the first newspaper to cover the whole Island and distribution has grown from 2,500 copies a week to around 34,000 copies which are distributed to almost every Island household.Nearly 1,000 copies are also despatched each week to regular subscribers on the mainland and abroad in countries including America,South Africa,Malawi,Oman, Saudi-Arabia,Switzerland,Holland, Germany,Luxembourg,Panama,Canada and Australia.Throughout its history The County Press policy has remained the same-to provide objective,fair,and unsensational reports of all the week's Island news.A workforce of 95 are involved in the production of the paper.In June'85, County Press,one of the few independant weeklies,switched their printing method from Rotary letterpress to a web offset process.
